intro: Dichapetalum klaineanum, commonly known as the Klaineanum mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
